Peter's Drive-In.review: Burgers were super fresh and the milkshake was so thick and creamy. Worth the lineup.
Classic Calgary spot. Fries were a bit salty but the portions are huge.
Stopped here after a long drive. Quick service and the burgers hit the spot.

Five Guys Macleod Trail.review: Love that you can customize everything. Burgers were juicy and the fries are enough for two.
A bit pricey but the taste and quality are solid. Staff were friendly.
Peanuts while you wait is always a plus. Place was clean and service was fast.

A&W 17th Ave.review: Teen Burger is still my go-to. Fresh buns and the root beer was ice cold.
Good spot for a quick bite on 17th. Onion rings were crispy and not too oily.

McDonald's Brentwood.review: Busy location near the university but drive-thru was pretty efficient.
Fries were hot and crispy. Order was accurate which I appreciate.
Good late-night option. Dining area could be a bit cleaner though.

Popeyes Forest Lawn.review: Spicy chicken sandwich was amazing and still crunchy after the drive home.
Line was long but moved fast. Cajun fries were so good.

Harvey's Country Hills.review: Love that you can pick your toppings. Burger tasted really fresh.
Staff were super patient with my order changes. Frings are a must-try.

KFC Crowfoot.review: Chicken was hot and crispy. Mashed potatoes were decent too.
Order took a bit longer than expected but the food was fresh.

Taco Bell Sunridge.review: Classic Taco Bell cravings satisfied. Crunchwrap was made properly.
Good for cheap late-night snacks. Staff were nice.

Wendy's Bowness.review: Baconator was massive and the Frosty was perfect for dessert.
Drive-thru was quick and the food was hot. No complaints.

Chipotle 4th Street.review: Portions are huge. Burrito bowl was fresh and well-seasoned.
Love the options for toppings. Line moves quickly even when busy.

The Himalaya Restaurant.review: Butter chicken was rich and flavourful. Naan was soft and fresh.
Great family-style spot. Portions are generous and service is warm.

Bindas Eatery Calgary.review: Butter chicken poutine is such a fun mashup. Really tasty.
Street food vibes with a modern twist. Loved the samosa chaat.

Masala Bhavan Restaurant.review: Curries had deep flavour and just the right spice level.
Gulab jamun was a perfect finish. Friendly staff.

Tamarind East Indian Kitchen.review: Tamarind butter chicken was incredible. Would definitely come back.
Nice ambiance and attentive service. Garlic naan was so good.

Bombay Chowpatty.review: Felt like Mumbai street food. Pav bhaji was spot on.
Great vegetarian options. Masala chai was comforting.

Indian Flavours Kitchen.review: Tandoori chicken was smoky and tender. Good value for what you get.
Nice cosy place. Loved the paneer butter masala.

Calcutta Cricket Club.review: Beautiful decor and really unique menu. Kathi rolls were amazing.
Cocktails and small plates were on point. Great date-night spot.

Moti Mahal.review: Classic comfort Indian food. Chicken korma was rich and creamy.
Service was fast and naan was fresh. Would come again.

Royal India Curry House.review: Good lunch spot downtown. Butter chicken combo was filling.
Nice spice level and decent portions. Friendly staff.

Zaiqa Restaurant.review: Karahi was full of flavour and came sizzling hot.
Good place for sharing plates with friends. Naan was bit stale.

Avesta Shawarma.review: Best shawarma platter in the city!!!
Amazing vibes! The people here are so nice

Shawarma King.review: Falafel platter was fresh and nicely seasoned. Good portion size.

Jerusalem Shawarma.review: The shawarma could be better. The meat felt undercooked

Great Canadian Pizza (Halal).review: Love the pizza from here! Amazing food for late night drives

King Solomon Jamaica Kitchen (Halal).review: Lemon herb salmon was flavourful and not overcooked.
Nice hotel restaurant, good variety on the menu.

Ramadan Catering & Takeout (Halal).review: Striploin was tender and nicely seasoned. Dessert was great too.
Good option if you're staying downtown. Service was attentive.

Residence Inn by Marriott Beltline.review: Grilled chicken salad was fresh and light. Perfect for lunch.
Pasta primavera was creamy without being too heavy.

Sandman Signature Calgary Downtown.review: Casual vibe with decent pub-style food. Cheeseburger was solid.
Tomato basil soup and salad hit the spot on a cold day.

The Dorian Autograph Collection.review: Braised short ribs were incredible. Beautifully designed space.
Great for a special night out. Presentation and flavours were top notch.

Alt halal Calgary East Village.review: Grilled chicken bowl was filling and fresh. Nice modern feel.
Good option if you're staying in East Village. Soup of the day was tasty.

Village Ice Cream.review: Salted caramel is a must-get. Lineups are worth it.
Great flavours and super creamy texture. Cute little spot.

Made By Marcus.review: Creative flavours that change often. Soft serve was amazing.
One of my favourite dessert spots in Calgary. Always something new.

Yann Haute Patisserie.review: Macarons were delicate and flavourful. Feels like a little piece of Paris.
Pastries are beautiful and delicious. Lemon tart was my favourite.

Ollia Macarons & Tea.review: Perfect spot for a small treat. Macarons were crisp outside, soft inside.
Great tea and coffee options. The gift boxes make nice presents.

Cinnaholic Calgary.review: Custom cinnamon rolls are dangerous in the best way. So many topping choices.
Everything is super sweet but perfect when youâ€™re craving dessert.

La Diperie.review: Dipped cones with toppings were so fun. Kids loved it.
Great variety of sauces and toppings. Can get busy in the evening.

Presotea Bubble Tea.review: Pearl texture was perfect and drinks weren't overly sweet.
Lots of flavours to choose from. Matcha latte was really good.

Tsujiri Calgary.review: Matcha soft serve tasted very authentic. Loved the parfait.
Great spot if you like matcha-based drinks and desserts.

Amato Gelato Kensington.review: So many gelato flavours. Pistachio and hazelnut were amazing.
Nice stroll in Kensington with a cone. Staff offered samples too.

Butter Block & Co.review: Best croissants in the city. Almond and chocolate are both fantastic.
Everything is super flaky and buttery. Coffee pairs perfectly.
